intro: Tragia boiviniana, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and alternate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It is known for its milky sap, which can be toxic if ingested. Tragia boiviniana is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and abandoned fields.
